result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Anthony Girtler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all court costs, fees, assessments and fees, DNA surcharge in this action during period of Extended Supervision, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
*Due to lack of income, Court waived the domestic abuse assessment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other senence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation.Take all prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.

No contact with victim unless the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Complete batterer's intervention program.
Cooperate fully with probation agent.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample if not already given, pay the DNA surcharge.
Court ordered defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored pon completion of sentence. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Anthony Girtler

records.addlTxt:
Per Remittitur, Dated August 25, 2020, Appeal Nos. 2016AP001109-CRNM (14CF003214), 2016AP001110-CRNM (2014CF003215), 2016AP001254-CRNM (2014CF000197), IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on June 30, 2020, that:  
IT IS ORDERED that the judgments of conviction are summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Becky Nicole Van Dam is relieved from further representing Mark Anthony Girtler in these appeals.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).  
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that upon remittitur, the trial court shall correct a scriveners error in the judgment of conviction for Milwaukee County Circuit Court case No. 2014CF197, as outlined in this decision.
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt: Per order dated June 30, 2020, Appeal Nos. 2016AP1109-CRNM (2014CF3214), 2016AP1110-CRNM (2014CF3215) and 2016AP1254-CRNM (2014CF197) IT IS ORDERED that the judgments of conviction are summarily affirmed.  See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Becky Nicole Van Dam is relieved from further representing Mark Anthony  Girtler in these appeals.  See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3).  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that upon remittitur, the trial court shall correct a scrivener's error in the judgment of conviction for Milwaukee County Circuit Court Case No. 2014CF197, as oulined in this decision.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.
records.descr: Court of Appeals decision & order affirming

Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCE HEARING (PART 1) commencing FEBRUARY 20, 2015 received and filed. (42 Pages.)

Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Statements made as to sentencing. Additional statements by: Patricia M. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, consecutive with any other sentence, with credit for 365 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR. 
. 
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program; is not eligible or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. 
. 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-No Contact with victim, unless the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.   
-Complete batterer's intervention program.
-No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
-AODA assessment and comply with treatment. 
- Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
-Cooperate fully with probation agent. 
-Maintain full time employment. 
-Pay all court costs, assessments and fees in this action during period of Extended Supervision, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
-Due to lack of income, Court waived domestic abuse assessment.
. 
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. 
.
Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample if not already given, and pay the DNA surcharge during Extended Supervision, or to be docketed as a civil judgment. 

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement, and Pretrial Sentence Credit.
from Richard P. received and filed. tk

  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Patricia M., Lynette R. and Richard R. Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
*
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for status conference.  Attorney Bowe would like a plea date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
State's motion for joinder heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court granted the motion and ordered 14CF197, 14CF3214, 14CF3215, 14CM474 and 14CM552 joined for the purpose of trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for December 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
State's Motion to Join for Trial received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm
At the request of the Court, the 11/19/14 motion hearing is rescheduled to 11/25/14 at 1:30 pm.  All parties agreed.  rmm

Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in custody.  Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  State will be filing a motion with the Court by 10/24/14; defense to file response by 11/07/14.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

As parties feel there should only be one attorney for all of the defendant's cases, Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Anne Bowe will be counsel of record in this matter. Case adjourned for status in Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for October 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in court with attorney Jeffrey Lee Murrell.  Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Competency Hearing proceeded.  State does not challenge Dr. Mark Phelps report.  Defense does challenge Dr. Phelps report.  Court qualified Dr. Phelps to testify as an expert.  Sworn for the State:  Dr. Phelps.  Testimony closed.  Arguments heard.
After review of all evidence, report of Dr. Phelps, and testimony of Dr. Phelps, Court finds defendant competent.

Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in court with attorney Jeffrey Lee Murrell.  Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Parties have reviewed the doctor's report.  Defense disagrees with the findings and would like a competency hearing.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Clerk left a voice mail for Dr. Phelps.  Competency hearing scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in court with attorney Jeffrey Lee Murrell.  Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Doctor's report received and filed.  Defense would like more time to review it with the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.
from Mark Phelps, MD receieved and filed.   rmm

Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in court with attorney Jeffrey Lee Murrell.  Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Report reviewed by the parties.  The examining doctor could not reach a conclusion as to the defendant's competency and recommended defendant be transferred for an in-patient examination.  The Court found that an inpatient examination is necessary and committed the defendant to a state hospital for a competency examination and report pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2)(3) of Wisconsin Statutes.  Court reminded the parties the order revoking telephone, mail and visitation privileges will still be in effect.  Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return in Branch 40.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in court with attorney Jeffrey L Murrell.  Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in custody.  Michael C Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case here on state's motion to withdraw defendant's visitation, telephone and US Mail privileges.  For reasons stated on the record, Court granted the motion.  Order signed and filed.  Return of Doctors Report set for 7/11/14 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in court with attorney Jeffrey L Murrell.  Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in custody.  Ryan T Sanson for Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Order for Competency Examination, signed and filed. Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit. Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Defendant examined by the Court and Court found defendant freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to a speedy trial.  The 6/23/14 jury trial is vacated.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in court with attorney Jeffrey L Murrell.  Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed. Based upon discussion with Attorney Murrell and past history of defendant's criminal record, Court denied the request for a competency examination.  Case is adjourned to  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jeffrey L Murrell in court, defendant Mark Anthony Girtler not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status Conference held.  State to file joinder motion with the court by 5/16/14; defense to file response by 5/30/14.  Motion will be addressed at the final pretrial conference.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Counsel informed Court there has been a breakdown in communication.  Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defendant examined by the Court as to his right to a speedy trial and found defendant freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to a speedy trial.  Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant.  Court advised defendant this will be the last public defender appointed.  Case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  The 4/28/14 jury trial is vacated.  Status conference scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Case set for final pretrial conference.  Parties would like a short adjournment.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Information filed.  Defense counsel waived reading of the Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in custody.  Michael C. Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.    Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #'s 06CM740 and 06CM4265 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Detective Michael Chaperon.  Exhibit #1 received.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Exhibit withdrawn.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Arraignment scheduled for January 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Patricia M and her children

Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Mark Anthony Girtler in custody.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
